description.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child to access ECD and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 0843-03045 Panama Republica de Panama

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Latin America & The Caribbean Regional Office 2018 Annual Report
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child to access ECD and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

description.narrative: Governments in LAC have approved the Regional Road Map for the implementation and monitoring of the E2030 Agenda, which aims at ensuring twelve years of free quality education for children and adolescents in LAC. 21 countries in LAC are currently part of the Worldwide Initiative for Safe Schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/02/2019

title.narrative: Number of Countries developing Gender-Responsive Education Sector Plans with UNICEF standards.
Number of countries with plans, strategies and programmes to improve school access, retention and learning outcomes of children on the move, based on international standards, with UNICEF support

Number of countries with national plans, strategies and programmes to prevent school dropouts, improve school access, retention, progression and completion at all educational level and for re-enrollment of OOSC and adolescents with UNICEF support

Number of countries with inter-sectoral and inter-agency coordination mechanisms to promote policies and mechanisms of preparedness and rapid responses to guarantee education services for children affected by emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts with the support of UNICEF
